title: 16-year-old boy dies 2 days after Englewood shooting
content:
A 16-year-old boy died on Friday, two days after he was shot in the Englewood neighborhood on the South Side.
Officers found Diabolique Anderson about 4:45 p.m. Wednesday on a sidewalk in the 6800 block of South Green with gunshot wounds to the head and thigh, according to Chicago Police and the Cook County medical examiner’s office. Witnesses saw four males take off in a black SUV after the shooting.
Anderson, of the 100 block of East 68th Street, was pronounced dead at 2:28 p.m. Friday at Christ Medical Center in Oak Lawn, the medical examiner’s office said. An autopsy showed he died of gunshot wounds and his death was ruled a homicide.
Area South detectives were investigating.
